events.name: Meteor January 2016 Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm.  ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - Blockchain and Dropping Your Database - Paul Du Long Removing the reliance on data storage with Blockchain in Meteor. #2 - SPECIAL GUEST HANGOUT - Arunoda (Meteorhacks/Kadira) presents Mantra We are very privileged to have a special hangout with Arunoda from Meteorhacks/Kadira for him to present Mantra. Link: https://voice.kadira.io/introducing-mantra-fb1d960f0511#.o9coxgkcv #3 - ES2015 module support in Meteor 1.3 - Max Foo An introduction to the new support for Modules in Meteor. #4 - TBC #5 - Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: </a>https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: <a href="https://meteorsg.slack.com/">https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: <a href="http://singapore.meteor.com/"></a>http://singapore.meteor.com/ Looking for volunteers to help run and organize the Meteor Singapore meetup group and events. #6 - Socializing / Networking  ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Organizers: Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur Venue sponsor:
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Singapore Clojure Meetup #7 Clojure for Data Scientists and Clojure/CONJ 2015
events.description:
This is the first Clojure Meetup this year and we are pleased to announce that we have 2 exciting speakers. Clojure Language core contributor Mike Anderson will explore the numerical computing libraries of Clojure with particular application for Data Scientists and we have our very own Gabe Hollombe reporting from his trip to last November's Clojure/CONJ 2015 conference in Philadelphia giving us the low down on new developments coming to Clojure. Clojure for Numerical ComputingDescription: A walkthrough of Clojure tools for numerical computing and data analytics, with some interesting live-coded examples Mike Anderson is a major contributor to the Clojure community, most notably as the author and lead maintainer of core.matrix. He is the co-founder of Datacraft, a Singapore based company specialising in advanced data analytics and machine learning. Previously, Mike has worked with multiple startups and as a senior consultant on technology issues at McKinsey & Company. Tales from Clojure/CONJ 2015: Get the lowdown on what's new, interesting exciting and coming in the Clojure world direct from the principal language conference. Gabe Hollombe is a lead developer at Neo Innovation and is an experienced software developer of 15 years experience in enterprise software. He is an enthusiastic supporter of Clojure and is one of the co-founders of this meetup. 


Microsoft are kindly hosting us this month.

events.name: January Meetup
events.description: Hi folks!  We look forward to having you join us for our January meetup, on the 26th, venue @ PayPal, Level 9. We're still looking for speakers! Ping us (Winston or Guo Xiang) if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips.  See you on the 26th! Venue:  PayPal Level 9 @ 5 Temasek Blvd -------------- 1. "Slaying the Dragon: A Guide to Implementing Your Own Programming Language in Ruby" - @jasonyeojs from @srcclr 2. "Ruby and MS DOS: Extracting data from a 35-year old system for current use" - @raoulalwani from lachmann 3. "5 Random Ruby Tips" - @drenmi from @tinkerbox 4."5 numbers on the SG Ruby community"  - Sayanee @webuildsg 5. Open Source Hot Issues (Back by popular demand :P)  6. Announcements * Hot Picks- This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone canstand up and say something interesting!  -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices,so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips"that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must havecame across some interesting Ruby nuggets in thelast month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com,or Guo Xiang @tgx_world / tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! --------------Job Postings-------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting?Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Venue, Food and Drinks:
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985, Singapore
